column1: Table 5. Persons convicted in federal court with RICO as a secondary offense, by most serious offense, FY 2018–2022
Report title: Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations (RICO) Cases in Federal Courts, 2012–2022  NCJ 308952
Data source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, Criminal Master File, fiscal years 2018–2022
Authors: Suzanne M. Strong, PhD, and Mark Motivans, PhD, BJS Statisticians
Table 5. Persons convicted in federal court with RICO as a secondary offense, by most serious offense, FY 2018–2022
Most serious offense when RICO is secondary charge

Note: Details may not sum to totals due to rounding. The unit of count is a person in a case adjudicated with a conviction in U.S. district court. Persons charged in more than one case are counted separately. RICO denotes Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act.
Source: Bureau of Justice Statistics, based on data from the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, Criminal Master File, fiscal years 2018–2022.
